ygData.subject: ANN: SharpNEAT Release (03-May-2004)
ygData.msgSnippet: I wasn t intending to put out another release just yet as I am in the middle of a code reorganisation. However I though some might like to see the various

Subject: ANN: SharpNEAT Release (03-May-2004)
X-Yahoo-Group-Post: member; u=127853030
X-Yahoo-Profile: alienseedpod

I wasn't intending to put out another release just yet as I am in the 
middle of a code reorganisation. However I though some might like to see 
the various improvements as they stand today...

 - Marked improvement on single-pole search. In fact it's quite normal 
to see perfect solutions within the initial population! This is mainly 
due to using fully connected networks in the initial population. I 
discussed this with Ken and this is was also seen in his experiment's. 
The connection weight mutation has also been refined.

 - New double-pole-balancing and double-pole-without-velocity-input 
experiments.

 - Updated the pole balancing simulator to show force acting on cart and 
support double-pole experiment.

Zipped source code and .Net binaries here: http://www.cgreen.dsl.pipex.com/

One thing I'm just playing with now is an alternative fitness scheme to 
prevent the double-pole-without-velocity problem being solved by quickly 
wiggling the poles, as described in "Efficient Reinforcement Learning 
through Evolving Neural Network Topologies" (Ken and Risto 
Miikkulainen). This is in the released code/binaries but I haven't had 
chance to experiment with this yet, I did a quick run and it still 
evolved 'wiggling' solutions.

Regards,

Colin
